Reviews.Title: “Just be prepared for the answer NO on a short stay”
Reviews.Author: wsugirl
Reviews.Content: A party of three stayed there over Easter break of 2012 and we were not sure what we were getting into at the time. It was the cheapest place in Kissimmee and we have mixed feelings about the place. Check in was absolutely perfect and the guest clerk answered all questions that we had. They gave us a pamphlet and accommodated us since we were handicap. Parking was an issue up front since the restaurant Angels was up front so beware if you have a front room. Once we walked into the room, it looked like a standard hotel room with an apartment fridge and a microwave. They did supply us with 4 pillows, 4 towels, 4 washcloths, one bar of soap and a roll of toilet paper. When we went to the front desk for a trash bag and another roll of toilet paper, we were told it was not part of the short stay policy. We did have to dump our own trash daily and no room service was given the three nights we stayed. The room was clean and we did have cable and free wireless internet. it was quiet and not too many complaints. We just wanted to make sure that if you decided to stay here, bring your own supplies because with three people in the room it does run out. Bring plenty of quarters if you want to wash your towels daily too!! Overall we were ok with the room since most of the time we were in the parks. Just be prepared to hear NO when you ask for something!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, is fine if you aren't picky”
Reviews.Author: gravitrue
Reviews.Content: Just stayed five days. It was fine. Things that were good: Desk clerk, building engineering, and security folks we dealt with were all pleasant. A failing light bulb was replaced promptly. Frig was full-sized, water was hot and pressure good, ac was fine, mattresses ok, very quick drive to disney parks, convenient to restaurants and grocery stores. Things that bugged me: No alarm clock. Only one layer of curtains, so our room could either be dark, or else people could see right in; nothing translucent. Big electric sign out front advertises $49/night, desk clerk claims they don't offer that rate any longer (but for a five day stay, the weekly rate was cheaper than that anyway). Had to get our keys redone twice, probably a computer issue. Unlike other reviewers, they did not give us a hassle for asking for a new roll of toilet paper, nor did we see or hear any altercations or police visits. Things that might bug you: carpet had a stain, paint on the safe in the room was peeling, tons of rules; photo id required for each person given a key and parking permits required to be in the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Natalie!!”
Reviews.Author: Leolioness4200
Reviews.Content: We had the WORST check in experience of our life at the Knights Inn Maingate which caused us to cancel before we even finished the check in paperwork.....We went over the Home Suite Home and Natalie was working behind the front desk. She was SUPER nice and gave us 2 rooms close to the main lobby right next door to each other since I was traveling with my family.....I would stay here again just because of the service I received when I just walked in to this hotel.....DO NOT STAY AT KNIGHTS INN MAINGATE!! Stay here instead!! Thanks Natalie for saving our vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “HomesuiteHome Maingate Kissimmee FL”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: Staff very polite. On site maintenance very efficient. Our manager Shaundra kept a very clean and tidy facility. Rooms were big and good quality. Lived here (maingate) for nearly 1 year and never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Get Your Money Back”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang V
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10 years ago under the old management and had a wonderful weeks stay. We returned to find that the new management is living off the old Nikki Bird name and making a sizable profit while not keeping the place clean or repaired. Its the oldest trick in the book. Yes the police are called frequently. Yes this is not a place for kids. Yes we got our money back after a quick 2 minute talk with the owner who doesn't want his operation shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for a week in Orlando and have money left over!!”
Reviews.Author: VegasChik
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at this location about 5 times now, I usually travel alone, and for me to be comfortable (as a female) someplace is saying that i feel safe here. I dont care what anyone says, but $149+tax for 7 nights stay anywhere is awesome..as long as you like it, It is super duper close to Disney World and right off the major freeway and highway. House cleaning is only done once a week tho and you must empty your own trash. this is just fine for me because i not like random housekeepers coming into my "private" room each morning to clean.I never see anyone "hanging out" (even late at night) and i am never awakened with loud people or noises. I like to stay on the top floor and love the fact there is a full refrigerator and microwave. but remember, this is a no frills weekly and people make this their home, so for larger families?? Only bummer i would say is that there is no daily housekeeping and it might get messy for you, but greatttttt way to save money for other things you want to do while you are in town! Im going back again this month!

Reviews.Title: “NASTY PLACE MANAGEMENT INEPT ~ place was filthy and nonaccomidating”
Reviews.Author: disneymomma60993
Reviews.Content: You would think with so much competition for clients along the 192 strip that this hotel would try to manage a facade of caring. The place was filthy. Our toilet was broken. They really didn't care. You had to physically go to the front desk to ask a question because they never answer the front desk phone. The manager would make a commitment to resolve an issue to my face, then nothing ever came of it. When asked who her boss was, she gave me her own name , thinking I wouldn't catch on. It is a waste of money and one of the most unpleasant stays I have ever experienced. the swimming pool was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this place unless you have no other options”
Reviews.Author: travelerperson130
Reviews.Content: First of all, Home Suite Home promised me a suite and you would think that given the name that is what they offer. Just to be sure I asked if I was getting a suite when I booked the room and they said yes. When we got to the room it was just a regular motel room with a refrigerator and a microwave. They didn't even have a coffee maker in the room. When I asked about it they told me that they regard this type of a room as a suite. To me a suite has a bedroom, kitchen, and living room. After we checked in we found out that they only offer housekeeping once a week and it is light housekeeping at that. We asked for our sheets to be changed and the maid gave us sheets, but she told us that we had to put them on ourselves. All she did was provide clean towels and sheets and then she left. She didn't even vacuum the floor or clean the bathroom. She didn't even take out the trash. She told us that was our responsibility. No wonder the place was so dirty when we arrived. While we were there we saw two cockroaches. Further, there was no hot water, so we had to take cold showers. The heat malfunctioned on our second day there, but they did send someone to fix it and they had it working within an hour after we called. At least they did something right. Bottom line: Don't stay here unless you are so broke that you simply cannot afford anything better.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T Stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DellaBornman
Reviews.Content: We reserved this room over the phone from Portland Oregon. We were not informed that we would be required to supply our own toilet paper and garbage bags. We only got 5 towels, and 3 wash cloths which we had to wash in their machines which we paid them to wash their towels!!!! I reserved a first floor room with a sofa sleeper and poolside. I arrive after being on a plane all day only to find out that its a first come first serve basis. they already took my payment (in advance) 3 weeks before. To me, that would imply FIRST come first serve!! The bed spreads had cigaratte burns in the along with the sheet on the sofa sleeper which was broken by the way. The guest is required to strip our own beds and put the sheets in the tub if we wanted them changed. I worked in a hotel as a maid for years and this is the first time I've ever heard of such a thing. Its the hotel and the maid's job to strip the bed and change the sheets NOT the guest!!! Your pamphlet that they gave me upon arrival states that there was a bath mat supplied. I come to the office only to find out that's not the case and they don't even have them! Yet another deception. They stated their rooms are deep cleaned after every guest thus the reason I have to pay 35.00 upon check out. We got out of our already dirty shower (which was deep cleaned before we moved in right?) only to have our feet get dirty for the deep cleaned carpet!!! Not to mention that there were flea's in the room. One of my daughters had so many flea bites on her it was pathetic and I pulled a flea off my foot while sitting on the bed!!! The wall's had cracks in them, some of the HUGE ones like in our room, mold in the broken molding behind the bathroom door. I'm informed by staff upon arrival that the problem with taking reservations over the phone is that you dont have time to inform the guest that they will have to supply their own toiletries and to be specific about what those are. Toilet paper and garbage bags would have never crossed my mind since that would be the hotels responsibility. They treated their temporary guests like permanant one's and to me, that's unacceptable. I will never stay in this hotel again or ever recommend it to anyone. In my opinion, the health department should shut them down based on the condition of the rooms, pools and grounds. The pools were so dirty that my teenagers wouldn't swim in them! And just so everyone understands, my kids are fish, they love to swim and would be in the water all day long if they could!!! The staff acted like they had no concers about any of my complaints and their attitude was, too bad, we have your money and your stuck here! I would not recommend this place to ANYONE!! Not even to people who need a place to transition.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Dantraveler47
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking to stay in this place make sure you bring Cockroach's spray, a gun, clean sheet and Lysol spray. This is by far the worst hotel I ever stayed. No more comments.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rates ----- false advertised.”
Reviews.Author: klhIndiana
Reviews.Content: Just called to make a reservation. Was told that they don't know who put the rate of $22.00 per night on their web page but that is NOT an availble rate. The "real" rate quoted to me was $168.00 for a weeks stay. I don't want to stay a full week. EITHER FALSE ADVERTISING OR BAIT AND SWITCH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worse than the worst”
Reviews.Author: Alommin
Reviews.Content: Falling headboards, detachable doorknobs, (which, at least, were fixed w/in two hours) and a complete lack of amenities. This does not deserve even a "one-star" rating. No towel replacements, no ice available, one chair, no table, room was dirty and smelled of damp and mildew... I'm surprised the roach we killed in the TV stand drawer had the temerity to live there. As to surroundings, let's just say I'm fortunate to have a ccw license. After visiting more than forty hotels and motels on a cross-country trip two years ago, I can say the worst among them was far better than this. I have informed our organization's schedulers - Never again at this place! The old saw still holds true... you get what you pay for. If your expectations for accomodations are standard or lower, don't even consider here - if you expect nothing in the way of service, supplies, or surroundings... you'll get it. Caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and location OK”
Reviews.Author: ScottMc37
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week, for the price $139 was worth it, room a decent size, maid service only once a week, internet worked but slow, tv channels ok and felt ok sitting out by pool. For the money OK, might stay again if I cant get somethine else for $50 more.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer be ware”
Reviews.Author: hollinm
Reviews.Content: the first clue was the fact the front desk was behnind bullet proof glass. we signed so many papers where they warned us about this, that and the other thing and how we would be charged extra if we did something to the room. They took our drivers's licence and credit card and photostated them. The only thing they didn't do was fingerprint us. We are an older retired couple hardly crooks or terrorists We entered the room and it was musty and smelled like stale booze and cigarettes. It reeked and even buying scented candles did not remove the smell. It was pungent and never left for the whole week we were there. the bed was comfortable but the furniture was old and the carpet stained. the fridge worked fine but we didn't want to put anything in the microwave. the bathroom was decrepit with chips out of the bathtub and black stains on the caulking. The shower was small and you could not avoid touching the shower curtain. The tiles in the ceiling were stained and broken. Lysol did not help. The bathroom was so small the door did not close if you were sitting on the toilet the pools were ice cold the price was right but we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near Disney”
Reviews.Author: AwwBabyElelphants101
Reviews.Content: Very nice pool area, the live entertainment on certain nights was an added bonus. We especially enjoyed the steel drums. The rooms were great for what we paid. Good deal. It's right on 192, so there was a bit of traffic getting to and from the Disney parks...but if you're looking to save money, this is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BoricuaJoe
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable and it had a full refrigerator and a microwave. Full cable tv with 3 HBOs and Showtime plus wireless internet. Has laundry facilities and clean pool. Shop had limited groceries but took care of the basics and the staff was friendly. The place is not fancy, but if you are looking for a good value in the Disney area, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: traveller55535
Reviews.Content: Am staying for extended time for employment, and find this hotel a nice quiet place. Beds are comfortable, and I have a full size fridge and microwave. Security is great and if I have any problems the friendly staff makes sure that it is corrected immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Even Think About Staying Here!! You Will Be Very Sorry Turst the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: DisneyCM
Reviews.Content: Ok, I do not normally post reviews but I hae to in this case. This place is the worst place that you can possiable stay in the orlando area. If you are on vaction, do not even think about it, you will not save any money. If you are in transit, keep going down 192, there are several place's that are 100 times better for the same money. I had to move out of the cottage I was renting for the last three years and I went here because of the cost and the discount I got for being a Disney Cast Member. Little did I know this place is run by slum loards. I am not lying. When you arrive and go into check in you are greeted by bulit proof glass. There are two of Home Suite Homes in the area and they both have this glass, the only hotels in the area that uses this. (should be your first red flag) The staff are extrelly rude and unprofessional. They are very dirty and shady. I was in a bnd so I thought I would suck it up and give it a try. The grounds are filthy as well as they laundry room. I had a room with a king bed and it was not kept up at all. The shower head was broken and remained that way till after I left. The bathtub had peeling paint and was un kept. To give you an idea of the type of service I recived. During my stay my TV went out and I called the front desk multiple times and they said they would send some one up. This was at 1:00pm. No one ever showed. A day latter at 11:30pm while I was sleeping there was a knock at the door and it was two very unkept guys that clamed they were with maint. Against my better judgement I let them take a look. They smelled to high heven of alcohol and cig smoke. The looked at the TV and everything else in my room and said they would call the problem in. Long story short it took three days to get a replacmen TV and they refused to give me any type of credit. On my second night I arrive home at 2:30am after I got off work to be greeted by not one, two or even three but 9 police cars and a polie helicoptor above. The next day I talke with a orange county officer and found out they are called to this hotel on a nightl basis. No matter what time you arrive you are greeted by people lotering outside there rooms drinking beer and smoking. Oh, BTW, this is against there rules. People have parties out side there rooms and when you call security to assist, they are actully friends with every one so they join them. If oyu do not beleave me take a drive bu around midnight and see for youself. It is very scarry. The staff is there for one reason, to take and hold on to your money. They charge a $100 deposit if you pay cash and they hold on to it for over two weeks to collect the intrest. Oh the house keeping is a joke! They come once every two weeks and your lucky if they clean the toliet and vacume. The staff again is extremely unprofessional and they do not care about your stay or your safety. When you go to they with a problem they blow you off and ignore you. This place is really for the homeless as its run by slum lords and should not be used for vacation at all. DO NOT be fooled by the cheep price. Go accross the street to Knights Inn or even Motel 6. They have the same so called amminites. Or go further down 192 and there are multiple places that you can stay at for extened stays. Oh if you must stay here, DO NOT use you credit card! Pay Cash. I am not accusing anyone but I had some one gethold of my debit card number and make a bunch of charges. I can not prove anything but I have heard that I am not the only one that it has happen too. Well thats about it. I can NOT impress on every one about staying AWAY fom this palce. It really needs to be shut down!! Read ALL of the reviews and form your opinion. you will see a patern and you can tell which reviews were posted by the so called employees that live there. STAY AWAY...YOU WILL BE SORRY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Turn Around and Never Look Back”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel3154
Reviews.Content: Friends of ours had recommended the Home Suite Home to us. Friends of theirs had stayed there years ago and said it was a great place and great rates. We looked it up on the internet and looked at pictures and said, well, looks a bit out dated but looks okay other than that, so we reserved this for two weeks. When we got there, it was a different story. By the time our plane landed, and we got our car rental, and got to the motel, it was around midnight, the doors were all locked up, there was no one around, we had to use the outdoor phone to call the motel manager to come and give us our keys; we had booked two different rooms which were supposed to be side by side. Our rooms ended up being wayyyy at the other end of the motel wayyyy in the back, which was veryyyy skechy and dark. We walked up the creepy, dark, dirty stairway, and the locals that stayed there year round were leaning over the balconies staring at us, and asking us what rooms we were in. Did not like the sounds of that at all, but they knew right away which rooms we were staying in as they followed us down the hallway. Once in our rooms, we locked our doors and pulled the curtains across as fast as we could. Looked around, the place was disgustingly dirty, smelly, moldy and just plain gross. The carpets were dirty and disgusting and stained, everything you touched, like the lamps, the t.v, the night stand tables, whatever you touched was sticky, not even washed or cleaned ever, the bathroom was old as the hills, it reminded me as well of right out of a horror movie, like someone was watching me from a hole in the wall or something, none of us showered, used the facilities, nothing.. we just climbed on top of the bed, didn't dare get in the sheets, but we were tired, by this time it was around 1am, so we just got on top of the bed and slept like that. I slept with one eye open the whole night, got no sleep. The other couple that came with us, they had a young child with them as well with severe asthma, she couldn't handle the smell in the room nor the mold growing everywhere, she awoke the next morning with a big rash down both of her legs. They had also awoke in the middle of the night because of some big scuffling and fighting right outside their door. Needless to say, we woke up as early as possible, headed down to the front desk, and told them the accomodations were not very accommodating, the carpets were dirty and there was mold everywhere. The hotel was not going to give us our money back as we had booked for two weeks, but we were not giving up. We asked to speak to the manager, they said the manager wasn't in until whatever time, so we hung around until the manager came in. They gave in and gave us full credit and we got the heck out of there. As we were leaving, the sheriff was pulling in and patrolling around the building. We were never soo glad to be out of there in all our lives. We did not feel safe, there was no security that we could see, the place was dirty, dark and full of bugs, and cockroaches and whatever else we couldn't see, we will never step foot near that place again. For the rest of our trip, everytime we drove by the place, all we did was shutter and step on the gas. Never Again.

Reviews.Title: “HomeSuitHome - "If you're a ROACH, then you're right at home"”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyResident
Reviews.Content: I'm just going to keep this as simple as I can: 1) The rate is definately not what is advertised, still the lowest though. (and you'll soon see why) 2) First thing you do, is sign your life away saying they are not held accountable for anything that happens to your room, even if the plumbing stopped working or the walls fell apart and the hotel staff was not available to fix it. 3) You have to wash your own towels. 4) I saw police activity within 15 minutes of getting there. 5) Residents actually LIVE here, they tend to be the ones who can't afford Section 8 housing...so you can see what kind of people this place attracts. Stereotypes are welcomed. 6) It's been 48 hours, and the roach count is 5. Amazing to see the entire life cycle of the roach. 7) The toilet backs up every time it flushes. I do a little prayer every time I flush, it helps. 8) The shower had so much mildew and rust that I swear the Health Department would condemn this property. Even parts of the tub were coming off as you showered. 9) They only provide one toilet roll and two small soaps, you supply everything else. 10) On a positive note, they had a brand new fridge and a newer microwave; however they don't allow you to wash anything down the sink or tub so cooking isn't an option. God forbid you have a tv dinner, because roaches will be all over the trash by morning. 11) I feel like I was in one of those horror flicks, and any second someone would stab me around the corner, even with security walking around. 12) I checked out of the property with a severe cough, a sore throat, and dry, burning eyes.....I think there is a serious FUNGAL problem HERE. 13) Security is a joke. People drive at 6am banging their music down the street. At 3am, party noises are a regular. Don't ever go to the laundry-mat alone, or go outside after dark for that matter. DON'T EVEN GO HERE. THE EXTRA 30 BUCKS I WOULD HAVE SPENT AT THE RAMADA OR DAYS INN WOULD HAVE BEEN WELL WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “Expect What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: riversb
Reviews.Content: You have to be a little "hearty" to stay at this hotel, but if you are trying to be frugal with your Disney trip and you are basically looking for a place to shower and sleep, you can stay here all week for what a typical hotel in the area will charge for a night! THE POSITIVES: The price ($150 for 7 nights), the A/C was cold, the bed was comfortable with clean sheets, the shower was hot, everything was in working condition (fridge/microwave/iron/ hairdryer), and of course number one - the place is 1/2 mile form the maingate of Disney - incredible easy access! THE NEGATIVES: The people who are "living" here make the neighborhood seem a bit rough, but no one ever bothered us. The room furnishings are mismatched and showing their age. I saw 2 roaches in a week (but this is Florida). The room was a bit musty. They supply you with a couple of towels, your first roll of t.p., and one small bar of soap, and there is no housekeeping. To save the big bucks, we had no problem buying our own soap and t.p., we were just interested in a clean place to shower and sleep while we did Disney for a week. Given all of this, at the current rate of deterioration, (and we have stayed at this hotel many times in the past 7-8 years when it was a Holiday Inn) we probably won't book here a year from now unless we find out they have made some updates to the rooms. It is "ok" now, but it is going to need some updating (carpet/furnishings/ paint/upkeep) before I would stay a year from now.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, bugs, and more bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Kim55
Reviews.Content: Sad to say that after being bamboozled by a less that trustworthy travel agency who assured us that the reviews we read were about the "other Home Suite Home property," we almost had our family trip ruined. After much anticipation and money spent to prepay for our accomodations, not to mention the flights from Canada, we arrived at Home Suite Home only to find our first room infested with cockroaches. Being from the north, I have never seen such a thing. They were crawling everywhere. My poor 10 year old will probably never be the same! After reporting this to the front desk clerk, we were given another room after their security went to check it out. Upon arrival here, we found a very offensive odor. It seemed like something had been sprayed, possibly to get rid of bugs and stains and a bathroom I wouldn't bathe my dog in. The only positive about this place was that the poor girl at the desk behind the half inch thick plate glass, (I wonder if they knew something that we didn't about the type of people staying here?) did seem to feel really bad for us. We were unable to stay because it was awfully dirty, and there were quite a few unsavoury folks hanging about, making us nervous. It was just such a shame that we had to arrive hundreds of miles from home with kids in tow to shell out another thousand dollars to stay somewhere clean and bug free. We are not too picky, but come on, cockroaches?!?

Reviews.Title: “Home suite home I would never bring my family there”
Reviews.Author: ppmark3
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. There are roaches that will walk you the mold in the rooms are so bad you can't breath. The staff are theifs. There are drug dealers living in just about everyone building The pools were closed by the health department due to bacteria. The staff just didn't know what they were doing we stayed there for a month in transition of buying a home. In one of there Kid suites VERY BAD MOLD WHEN WE TOLD THE OFFICE THEY SAID THEY WOULD CHECK ON IT AND NOTHING EVER HOUSEKEEPING CAME TO OUR ROOM EVERY 2 WEEKS AND STOLE SOMETHING FROM US EACH AND EVERY TIME WHEN WE TOLD THE OFFICE OH THERE IS NOTHING WE CAN DO THEY STATED I RECOMEND NO ONE EVER GO TO THIS MOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great, but if you can laugh it off...”
Reviews.Author: buzz431
Reviews.Content: This is a funny place. I'm used to staying in nicer hotels but needed a place to live while I worked on the Jaws ride, so this was a great cheap place! I found bugs, there was crime and I think I fought with the front desk people several times. It's okay to stay here if you just cope with it by making fun of it. Like me: [--] Watch that, I made it a week after I moved in. I thought it was a good way to get back at them for the crap. It's not a terrible place for the price, but I would'nt suggest that a family stay here. Just watch the video and you will see.

Reviews.Title: “Decent For The Money”
Reviews.Author: flavender
Reviews.Content: OK; this was not the best hotel that I've ever visited; but it was clean and the staff was very friendly. Our room was cleaned regularly throughout our 4 night stay. We hardly were in the room anyway with all of the attraction in the area. The pool was great along with the warm jacuzzi on those cooler nights. This was my daughter's first trip to Disneyworld and she loved every moment. If you’re on a budget and don’t mind doing without all of the high-end amenities, this is a good spot to post up for your stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Where ever I lay my hat
Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Daddybear3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its location and that was the only plus point. The service was non exsistant, the rooms were very basic and ours was situated under a canopy opposite the vending machines so there was no natural day light and constant noise. The Free transportation was terrible and didn't run at suitable times so i paid a fortune during my stay using the taxi's on site who were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: nimrod47
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel when it was still Holiday Inn Nikki Bird we had an email when the property changed to Home Suite Home confiming our booking would be honoured. This was not so, they refused point blank to honour our booking and we had to find another hotel, after travelling from UK we were tired and just wanted our bed. The service we got from Holiday Inns was RUBBISH and we will never book with them again. So be warned if you made your booking before the hotel changed hands you might find that you have to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this one if you can”
Reviews.Author: tripperATL
Reviews.Content: Got stuck with this property after "winning" our bid via Priceline. We arrived on the day of management change. Our only options were to seek a refund from Priceline while we went elsewhere and paid for another hotel at walk-up rates, or stick it out here. We stayed, while trying to reach someone at Priceline to move us. They did not, and only refunded our money after weeks of complaining. About the hotel: Close to Disney location is its best and only asset. The low price tag is another, though you can probably find better elsewhere. (This is no longer 2.5 stars on Priceline.) It's an older motel, that's a random outcropping of buildings around a mishmash of pools and other buidlings. Our building had no elevator, and exterior door access to the rooms. The room: smallish, smelled horrible, dirty. We had to spray it with Lysol twice daily. Because of the ownership change to an extended stay facility, there wasn't any maid service, towel exchange. Given the sad state of the property, we wouldn't dare eat there. Perhaps when they're done with the renovations, it'll be ok. But as is, it's worth paying a little more elsewhere for something decent.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Tater69
Reviews.Content: Made reservations back in March of 2006. Little did we know that this property was in the process of being sold. Recieved a letter and when we called to confirm our reservations we were told that all Holiday Inn reservations would be honored. Nothing could have been farther from the truth. We were told upon our arrival after driving 16+ hours that they had no reservations for us and that it was not their problem. I would have to contact Holiday Inn and see if they moved our reservations to another Holiday inn, since this was now a Home Suite Home property. After arguing back and forth with these people for the better part of 2 hours, they miraculously found us a room. Let me tell you, we only stayed that one night. We would have been safer in my opinion sleeping in our vehicle. There was commotions outside our room all night long, arguing , cussing and all of the other things that one likes on a family vacation. There are actually people who have taken up full time residency there. We ended up going to another hotel on Disney property after paying for our weeklong stay at this place, but it was worth the extra money for the peace of mind and security. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Pay the extra money and stay somewhere nice, you will be glad that you did.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Should have known that the price was too good to be true. We had booked two rooms adjoining rooms so that my grandson could go back and forth between the two rooms. When we got there, we were informed that those rooms were not available. The carpets were filthy and the rooms were damp. The air conditioner in my daughter's room got the carpet in the room soaking wet. You have to take out you trash at the end of your stay and there is no room service the first three days of your visit. There were no tissues in the tissue box and we were only given 1 bar of soap and 1 roll of toilet paper for the three days we were there. Good thing we brought some soap with us. The cleaning service is not all that great. We found a pair of sunglasses and a pacifier behind the night stand between the two beds. Then under one of the beds we found the container that held the game system that was installed in the room. We couldn't find an ice machine that worked and even if we did, we didn't have an ice bucket. The Direct TV didn't work the last two days of our stay. However, the mattresses were decent and the parking was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney.....”
Reviews.Author: BobbMeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for nine nights during May and found it to be OK. During our stay the hotel changed ownership from Holiday Inn to Home Suite Home, it was a great place when it was Holiday Inn but the new owners are not so good. I understand the room rates are now cheaper, but these people do not know what 'service' is. It is close to Disney and you can walk across/down the road to get something to eat. The rooms are good size and pool is great. We did not notice any cockroaches or lizards in the room as others have suggested, but with the attitude of the new owners I would not be surprised. At the end of the day you pay $150 for a whole week, and you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “A cheap price, but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: theresaspicer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nikki Bird in July of 2005. We never got a good nights sleep due to the AC maintance room was next to our room and made loud bangs and crashes all through the night. The hotel is not close to any resturants, so you have to drive or hire a taxi to go everywhere. The rooms are small and minimal. The resturants on at the hotel are fairly priced, but not have much fare and you do get tired of eating there. The best thing is the price, but pay a little more and stay at a resort on Disney.

Reviews.Title: “No longer a Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: AuntyMo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 12-19 and found it to be quite adequate for our needs. The room was a good size, fridge and microwave very handy for quick breakfasts, heating leftovers; quiet, nice pool areas - although like another reviewer, the towels seemed to be in short supply at the pools. The overwhelming fish smell in the lobby from the seafood restaurant was quite unpleasant in the evenings. On May 18, our last afternoon, we arrived back to find a letter from the management informing us the hotel would no longer be a Holiday Inn. It had been bought out and became a HomeSuiteHome on May 19. The new owners are making it a "long-stay" hotel with only 3-day or 7-day reservations - no change of linens or towels in that time. The rates are supposed to be "from $109 for 7 days". We spent 45 minutes in line trying to check-out the next morning. There were a lot of very angry and upset clients in line who had to "check out of the Holiday Inn system" and "check-in to the HomeSuiteHome system". The location is great and the rooms are fine considering the bulk of our days were spent at the theme parks. The only consideration for anyone now would be if they don't mind having their sheets and towels not changed during their stay.

Reviews.Title: “No longer a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservations two weeks before arriving through price line. At 2 o'clock in the morning we were driving up and down the highway searching for the Holiday Inn sign. Finally we noticed a tiny nikki bird sign under a big Home Sweet Home sign. Long story short - we werent in the computer. Got to stay for $149 per week though! Well, that's what our rooms were worth. We had too share our rooms with huge cockroaches and a LIZARD! Bathroom mold, gross carpet, stinky, door locks CONSTANTLY needing new keys. I paint a bad picture, but it wasn't THAT bad. The pools are very nice, the restaurant has an excellent buffet breakfast. You get what you pay for. This is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nikki Bird Hotel for a family vacation in May 2006 and loved the hotel. When we pulled up we were skeptical, it looks old and run down. We were pleasantly surprised because the room was larger than we had expected. We were able to sleep comfortably 2 adults and 2 older children in the double beds. The room was large enough to give us space to move around without being on top of each other. We only used one of the three pools because we were close to that pool and the layout was very family friendly. The only complaint I would have was that the pool was not cleaned well enough each night so we sometimes found hair and leaves floating in the pool water in the morning. They also need to replenish the towel supply more often. When we asked at the front desk for additional towel, they were brought to the pool area, but it would have been nice to have them right there waiting. We would definitely stay here again. The proximity to Disney World was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A Clean Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Disneytalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and found it to be a decent hotel for the price. I was a bit worried about the hotel from all the negative reviews that I have read here, but we found it to be quite the opposite. We arrived at 1:30pm and checked in with no problems at all, got the room with the king bed and the first floor room we had requested. It was facing the pool on the inside courtyard, but was a close walk from the parking lot. The room was very clean and had been recently painted. The refridge was very roomy and came in handy for sodas and some leftovers. There is also a small microwave in each room, but we did not use it. The bathroom was very clean, has a full tub and shower but is on the small side. The pool water was clean and just the right temperature to feel good after a hot day in the parks. We never used the hot tub, but they were clean looking and well kept. Our room was quiet, very quiet actually for a hotel which was fairly full. We were never woken up by people coming or going or by maids in the morning with squeaky carts. The staff were very pleasant and seemed ready to solve any little problems that came up. The hotel is a bit difficult to enter from the highway was the only main problem we had, but there is a traffic light to get in and out the main enterance. We did eat in the restaurant once for breakfast and the food was adequate but we found it rather bland. We plan on staying at this hotel again when we return to Florida and would recommend it to anyone who wants a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - the only bar stank like a fish market, poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing 2 week stay. Our family of 6 had a reservation for 2 adjacent rooms since last year, for 2 weeks. On arrival, after flying infrom England we waited in line for some 25 mins. to be checked in. The receptionist could not find our reservation on the computer. We showed written conformation. The manager had to be called. She managed to find us 2 rooms (well apart). with no chance of adjacent rooms during our stay. This check in took an hour. It was noted during our stay that other people had similar problems. During this stay, the housekeeping neglected on 7 seperate occassions to replace coffee and drinking cups. Complaints to the management had no effect apart from the promise that this would be put right. The only bar which was in The famous Angels Lobster House, it is badly situated with customers eating its popular dish within 2 or 3 feet of the bar. Bar customers had bar stools to sit on but no comfortable chairs and tables. Mind you, customer who could stand the smell were very few, which was not suprising for it smelt like a fish market. I believe that management may have taken over the bar room to accommodate more diners in this very popular diner. I tried to take a drink outside of Angels to avoid the smell, only to have the barman chase after me to advise that if I was not dinking the drink at the bar I would have to have it put in a plastic glass. I let him keep the drink! The Pizza snackbar staff seemed that they thought that you were being honoured by them serving you. It would have been appreciated if they could have served food which had been ordered. On the only occassion that we used this establishment to eat in, we were embarrassed by the attitude of 2 staff when we advised that we had not ordered food which they served us and left to eat elsewhere. The Pizzas to go were enjoyed by at other times. Our family love Florida & have visited regularly for some 15 years without any complaint. We are going back next month for 3 weeks - guess what - we will not be staying at the Nikki Bird!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel April 2006. As we were travelling alone, safety was important to us and we had no problems with this at the Holiday Inn. It wasn't the easiest of hotels to find as there are a couple of Holiday Inns along the Irlo Bronson Highway and the "Nikki Bird" part wasn't particularly highlighted very well on the sign. Once there, I asked for a quiet room (having read reports on Trip Advisor to get a room away from the stairwells due to people congregating there) and we were given a corner room directly outside stairs! I was a bit dubious about this but we didn't find it to be a particular problem. The only noise we got was people bumping their suitcases down occasionally. We had a 2 double bed room with microwave, fridge and safe in the room as well. The decor is a bit tired but cleanliness was very good and location is great for Disney. Breakfast was good value as children under 12 ate free but we found dinner a bit pricey so we found other places for that. I would say that you definitely need to hire a car to benefit from the restaurants and parks around the area. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Is it me?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival I started to dread the booking. Having already changed hotels with my travel agent before leaving the UK, I was beginning to feel a bit of a twit. I changed the first hotel as a result of reading trip advisor reports. The reports on Nikki Bird where good overall, I was comforted. Whilst stood in line at reception to book in I heard complaint after complaint. I had not realised at the time but all the complainers were American. I spoke to a British couple in the line who reassured me that it was fine. I came to realise from my two week vacation that an American will insist on a five star service for a three star price. The hotel Nikki Bird is good. The rooms are a bit tired but that comes with age. The bedding was clean the room and bathroom clean and well serviced everyday. The location for the parks was great. I have one slight criticism and it is a bit on the personal side. The receptionist, all of them, are not that switched on. It is hard work getting them to understand. We lost a towel and swimwear from the pool area. They were left out to dry. Hotel policy is all gear is cleared from the pool side by maintenance staff. We only wanted our stuff back. The 4 conversations we had with 4 different receptionist were hard work. The end result, we went shopping. Overall be assured the Nikki Bird is good. PS The hotel we changed from was the Imperial Swan. We did spend an hour checking out our decision. A wise one as it turns out, what a dump. I cant believe Virgin had it in their brochure. They haven't now!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Nikki Bird hotel on our long weekend getaway. It was a great value and a good location, for the price. I can not understand paying hundreds a night to stay on Disney property - put that money toward park tickets or souveniers! They have a few pools on site, an outdoor jacuzzi, an arcade, restaurant, a gift shop, etc. It is a very large property. They do shuttles to Disney World, but we had a rental car and did not use them. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. We stayed in a King sized Bed, non-smoking category. It was about $56/night + tax. There was a tv with regular channels plus on-demand programming and games (did not play) There was also a micro/fridge in our room, which most hotels charge extra for. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and would stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great whirlpools and pools”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I like the pool area at Nikki Bird so much that I trespass there every time I'm in Orlando (I'm from Tampa). They have very comfortable whirlpools and warm heated pools. So if you stay at the Super 8 across the street be sure to sneak in at the Nikki Bird to have a soak in the hottub.

Reviews.Title: “If you love trains, noise, & musty smells”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we've ever stayed at. If the rooms were as clean, nice-looking & updated as their lobby that would lessen the disappointment. (How could this be three stars???) If you can't smell, this hotel would be good for you b/c the rooms stink. Pool hours are NOT enforced, so expect all kinds of noise from the pools up until midnight or beyond. You will awaken at 6:45 AM to the roar of carts that the housekeeping staff rolls by your room EVERY morning. No naps in your room, for the carts come & go all through the day. They sound like freight trains rolling by your windows. They should invest in some "quiet" rubber wheels for their carts. If you love noise, can't smell, & have limited funds, then maybe it'll work for you. We were happy to check out & leave for good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value and service made this a great family get away!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews I was a little scared about what I might be in for. I was traveling for the first time alone with my two children. I was so happy with the accomadations!!!! The room was clean and cool(it had been a hot day) all the pools were clean and the water clear. We were NOT charged ANY resort fees on top of our original cost and checking in and out was fast and easy!!! Everything worked great and the noise level was zero, we heard no one else from our room. The maid service was wonderful. Give this place a chance, you will be happy you did, I know I was and so were my kids!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun with kids”
Reviews.Author: Texjuns
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 1-night stay at the Holiday Inn Nikki Bird. We stayed in a kid's suite, which our kids, ages 3, 11, and 12, loved! They had their own special place to hang out. On the down side, the video game is ordered through the tv, not a seperate unit, so we couldn't use our games we brought along. Also, it only had a VCR, not a DVD, so our movies were useless as well. However, for $7.00 for an hour of video games, the kids were entertained and we rested! The hotel is crowded, as is anything around Disney, but it did not seem the least bit noisy. Our room was clean, and the service was nice. It was too cold to swim, but the pools did look inviting! If we were staying off-property for Disney, this would be a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Tamara6959
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night on the way to Sarasota. The rooms look recently renovated and come with a fridge and microwave. The showers are extremely small so be prepared!! The grounds are well kept and all of the pool areas seemed pretty well maintained. One spa was closed but that didn't affect us at all. I think this hotel is great if you get it for $50 or less and aren't expecting anything more than a 2 star hotel with a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel not as bad as everyone says don't get kids suite though”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I worried about this hotel from the reviews left but it was a really nice hotel. No it's not fancy but it's clean and the people are nice. we stayed 4 nights and it was spring break week too. The hotel wasn't extremely busy. we reserved the kids suite which was suppossed to have 2 sets of bunk beds and a gamecube which is why we got it. I traveled with 3 kids and myself and my mother. we paid $90 per night and when we got to the hotel it had one set of bunk beds and a single bed in the kids part. the kids beds are VERY small so if your child is over 9 or 10 I don't recommend it. We mostly got the room for the gamecube entertainment for the kids. well every room has a gamecube built into the tv but they don't tell you until you ask that it's $7 an hour to play!! I thought paying extra for the kids room would include it but no it doesn't. we called the desk and switched to a cheaper 2 full size bed room. The rooms are nice and clean and they all come with a microwave and fridge which is GREAT with kids. The bathrooms are the smallest Ive ever seen but they aren't to bad if you open the door after you take a shower and get dressed in the doorway. we took showers when the kids were sleeping so it wasn't to bad. The pools are nice there are a lot of pools. they weren't crowded. only the hottub was busy of course with spring break. The kids loved it. the restaurant at the hotel called angels was nasty. not worth the high price at all. we had the breakfast buffet and it just wasn't very good. the ihop down the street was actually the best place we ate at. stay away from ponderosa that was horrible and I wouldn't recommend that to anyone. the pizza hutt in the phone book is cheaper than the hotels and they deliver too. the hotel staff was very friendly. there is a car rental place in the hotel that we used and I don't recommend that unless you're desperate and cant get another one. the man in there is rude and tries to rip you off. he claimed the gas was at half a tank when I picked it up which it was certainly not. it was at a fourth and I couldn't believe they left it so low. He tried to charge me ten bucks for that until I gripped. I left the gas higher than it was when I got it too. Overall I would recommend this hotel. the price at about 60 per night for the 2 beds in a room. wasn't bad for what you get. It is a clean hotel and no bugs or anything. that's all that mattered to me. the kids had lots of fun. I will stay there again if we don't get a villa next time.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely cheap, good enough, we weren't picky”
Reviews.Author: kristinr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nikki Bird for 3 nights, booked on orbitz or expedia for less than 50 dollars per night. This was a dream on our poor student budget! I don't know if all of the rooms are nonsmoking, but we requested a smoking room and didn't get it, so whenever we were actually in the room we spent a lot of time outside with the housekeeping people everyone's heard so much about. We also ended up in a KidSuite, which we totally didn't need since it was just my boyfriend and I... the lion painting on the "suite" bunk scared me every time I woke up in the morning! I did take a nap in one of the bunk beds, and they are quite comfy! On one of the days, the housekeeper never came at all, on the other 2 days she came in half-hour intervals early in the morning. Despite my pleas *in two languages* I never got any coffee packets in my room. Thank goodness for the 7-Eleven across the street! We did not use any of the "amenities," i.e. the pool, hot tubs or Angels, so I can't vouch for those. We did go to the front desk for a map and directions to the Universal area one afternoon, and the concierge gave us such bad directions we were lost for about 2 hours. If you just need a place to lay your head, you are not scared of a crappy motel, and you want to be really close to Disney, this is not a bad deal at all. I think in the future, though, we might spend the extra money to go to the Maingate West up the street *we originally pulled in there by mistake, what a gorgeous place that is!*

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a high end hotel, but at $50-60 per night it's more than ample... The pools were great, although one hot tub was WAY TOO HOT. The rooms were cleaned well each day, there was no problem with any part of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Early Check-out”
Reviews.Author: RobertH
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at Disney resorts (Polynesian, Port Orleans) when in Florida, but in an effort to squeeze another vacation into the annual budget I decided to take a chance on this place. Kind of a mistake. The bad: - The bathroom in our room smelled like urine, and had some small holes in the wall. - Every morning (6am) the cleaning crew were banging by our door with the laundry carts and making a lot of noise in general - not very courteous. - The water in the pool was slimey and smelled bad. The dumpster for Angels must have been on the other side of the fence, because the whole pool area smelled like garbage (seafood no less). The good: - The room aside from the noise outside and the bathroom, was about what I expected for this price range. - We thought the dinner buffet at Angels was ok. - Great location. - Good price. - Most of the staff were friendly. We actually toughed it out for 3 nights. On the 4th morning I got up and asked my wife if she wanted to stay, and without hesitation she said no. Even my two boys (6,10) wanted to leave. When checking out, the person at the front desk didn't seem surprised that we were leaving early, and didn't even ask why -- kind of a red flag. We checked-in to Disney's Port Orleans and had a whole new appreciation for a clean, well kept resort. In the future I think we'll stay away from the super-deal resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Best Off-Propery for the price”
Reviews.Author: BARFESSER
Reviews.Content: Hilton Nikki Bird I’ve been to Walt Disney World (WDW) a few times since I was a teenager in 1972. My last count puts it at (22 hotels). Most of them after I was out from under my parents wings. Some of them were just okay and some are still my all time favorites. With the advent of the Disney’s Value and Moderate Resorts (was that the 1990’s?) it was obvious that Disney was trying to capitalize on the Resort/hotel/Motel market. Personally I prefer to stay on the grounds, but barring winning the lottery there are limits. Currently our favorite off-site resort/hotel (old conventional doctrine would call it a motel – but we’ll refer to it as: resort) is the Hilton Nikki Bird Resort. It’s the closest off-site resort from the Southern entrance than any other. In fact (only because some weird folks would take the time to find out) it’s just as quick to get to the Magic Kingdom (MK) main entrance (by car) from the Nikki Bird Resort as it does from the “Love Bug” building at the All Stars Movies Resort. The Nikki Bird was the first to introduce us to the “Kid Suite” room. The first photo posted is of our first stay in Jan of 2002. The rate was a little less than the All-Star-Disney (the AAA discount helped), but because we knew it’s location and because we were on a budget and the Nikki Bird Resort includes a small refrigerator and microwave and gave it a whirl. The second trip in Oct05 the AAA rate was $45/night, Friday and Saturday was $54/night. We enjoyed our first stay and our kids loved it. Our second stay this past October of 05 was similar. We happened to arrive in anticipation of Hurricane Wilma and where present during her passing (Eye-wall passed 25miles south of us). The Room was clean (on both visits). The cleaning staff was attentive and personable. Most of our interaction with the resort was directly through the cleaning staff. The restaurant is designed around the buffet but you can order off a menu. The buffet is adequate for breakfast. Lunch we haven’t attended. The Lobster Dinner we had once but the price to quality ratio was too high to warrant a repeat. The bar staff is good and I had a few evenings relaxing there after the children were asleep. The swimming pools are above average. They are heated, numerous and well maintained. From what I can remember, there are 3 main pools, 3 whirlpools and 2 wading pools. Our family swum in all 3 main pools, the wading pools and 1 one of the whirl pools. All of them were warm and clean. There were no life guards and only a few times we wished the parents of the some of the children present would have been there to take corrective action. The first time we stayed in Jan of 2002 it was off season. The second, med season, was Oct of 05 (Hurricane Wilma). Because of the weather most of the people were staying because they were heading north or moving inland. The service staff didn’t seem overwhelmed either time. Only during peak seasons have I’ve noticed the service staff anywhere in need of their own vacation. Go figure. Ever been on a Spring break looking for a quite beach? It took a few adventures beyond the hedgerows and some friends in the business for me to understand. Tip the maids! Leave a note addressed to the staff with cash (a couple of bucks is all it takes, sometimes more) thank them for their service. If they go unnoticed and you never had need to call upon them, it means they’ve done their job better than most of us have done our own. These folks have access to whatever you leave in your room and can make or break your stay. You trust a waiter with your food and credit card. You confide in your bartender and sometime require their discrete advice. You trust in your driver to deliver you at the appointed place at the appointed time. All these people provide necessary and important services. When you return to your room, over tired, worn, weary yet happy because you were served well while you dinned, you took the advice of the bartender and your driver got you to where you needed to be. What then of the tip you only leave in advance. You might find only a clean room, maybe a thank you card. You might find your covers turned down, you might have an extra regular coffee packet, your children might find their stuffed animals arranged for a tea party, something pleasant, unexpected. Your stay may be worth the trip and you might have something to write home about or better yet, to smile about when you remember. I venture to say the price rendered in the service industry can easily exceed any investment in a greater proportion than any other. It doesn’t matter where you stay; it only matters on the last person to have access to your day. Our favorite Disney Resorts are: Wife’s choice: Polynesian Resort: Relaxing/Pools. Dad’s choice: Contemporary; Location/The best bar: Outer Rim – say Hi to Bruce, She’s the best! The pre-seating service at the California Grill needs work. Moderate: Port-Orleans Riverside. Generally quite, laid back, Boatwright’s has a great omelet for breakfast. Don’t miss Bob Jackson for a show at the bar! Well that’s enough about that.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace to Holiday Inn Name”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Nikki Bird "Resort" was the most disgusting hotel I have stayed at in recent memory. We used priceline to get two nights and I wish I had paid a little more to have our full stay at the radisson worldgate (which is a great hotel and was only $20 more on priceline). The hotel is dirty, and very rundown. They definately have not kept it up in recent years. While they had a couple hot tubs and a nice pool area, they were extremely dirty and had very visible scum lines. The restaurant inside was absolutely hideous for breakfast. There is an IHOP just down the street, I would recomment walking to it... You could also get better food in a garbage bin.... They screwed up our room reservation after me asking three times if he was sure he was checking us into the right room (I called ahead and reserved a king room upgrade and paid for the upgrade from the priceline base). The room they gave us was not clean, had some kind of crumbs all over the place, no towels and an A/C unit that was broken on the ON position..since it was 54F in orlando that night we were definately bundled into as many covers as possible. At any rate, this hotel is definately not worth it and should be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain hotel worth giving a shot - but don't expect luxury.”
Reviews.Author: disney06
Reviews.Content: My family stayed from Jan 28 thru Feb 4th. Everything was satisfactory - I had no problems with the service from the hotel, our rooms or the amenities. However - I requested in advance and then again upon check-in that I get two adjoining rooms. We were asked to wait an hour and a 1/2 while they got the rooms ready and when we finally go to check in - guess what? They were adjoining rooms, but not adjoined to each other!!! Also the room smelled like mildew but not unbearably so. Overall, for the $45 per night rate........it was worth the stay and I'd consider staying there again just for the convenience to the parks and great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: veronica3569
Reviews.Content: This place was great. If you are expecting a 4+ star hotel, go elsewhere. If you are looking for a family-friendly hotel in a great location, this is it! I brought my two girls (11 and 16) and we had a great time! The room was very clean and tidy, the bathroom was clean, I don't know what other rooms the other reviewers were getting. Staff was helpful with directions and friendly, the bar area was great and the game room a fun place to wind down. And the pool areas were nice as well. The jacuzzi in our area was "under construction" as well, but the pool was heated and its a short walk to the other area with a wonderful heated pool and jacuzzi! And it was quiet and not crowded at all. Again, you get what you pay for. Its a great place to stay if you are on a budget and I would recommend it to anyone and will be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week holiday in the Holiday Inn Nikki Bird, Kissimmee,Orlando. The hotel grounds and swimming pools were clean and tidy. At least one pool was heated sufficiently to swim daily. The hotel staff were polite and helpful, once they established what it was we required. The Nikki Bird Inn, well we had two double interconnecting ground floor rooms and all we wanted them for was sleeping and washing in the morning well job done. If you are wanting more than just rooms then you need a hotel and not motel/inn. We were please with Nikki Bird but that was our expectations of our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: tampabobl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights in February. I was in Orlando on business so I only needed a place to sleep which this place provided. If I was here on vacation I would be very disappointed with this place. Front desk personnel were very nice. I needed my room changed at check-in due to some construction, no problem. They say there is wireless internet available. It never worked for me and tech support said they would call back. I'm still waiting. The grounds over the hotel seemed run-down, but the room was clean and well kept. Ok for business, skip this place if you are taking a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would go back again!!”
Reviews.Author: Diegos2True
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - room was very clean and a plumbing problem was rectified quickly and efficiently. Pools were all gloriously warm and we noticed no litter around any of the site. Angels diner was a regular for breakfast and was very reasonably priced. Conveniently located for access to all the parks (by car) Would definitely recommend this hotel - fab!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic love hotel been three years”
Reviews.Author: madtwinmum
Reviews.Content: We have been going since 2000 until 2003 Only reason why didnt go 2004/2005 due to twins arrival. Love the fact has fridge/microwave/safe/ironing board. So convienant to Disney wouldnt stay anywhere else in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “ok, but you won't get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there December 23,24,and 25th. We were supposed to stay the 26th as well but checked out early. The hotel itself is okay, nothing fancy by any means, could use redecorating outside. The first night our heater stopped working but maintenance came up at 7:30 pm to fix it. The trouble is it worked for a few hours and quit again. The front desk staff is very helpful and will deal with trouble right away. Its not the hotel that is bad, its the people who stay there. Every night, people stayed up until 2:00 am or later and young kids were outside running up and down the stairs and sidewalks until early morning as well. There appears to be a party atmosphere among the people who stay there. Absolutely no consideration for others. If you want to take the bus to Disney or Epcot be first in line in the morning or you will not get on. Good luck getting back to the hotel. We had to hire a cab. This hotel is VERY crowded, not a place if your wanting to relax. Our room was clean and suitable but we had the one on the end next to the stairs and we were woke up every time someone ran up or down the stairs which was most of the day and night. The maid service is very noisy in the morning and will wake you up if the noisy neighbors don't. We left early due to lack of sleep. I have to give staying here a thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Um.... Not Very Positive”
Reviews.Author: TN-610
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at disney world. We had reservations for dec.29-31 at Disney's Carribean Beach but decided to go a couple days earlier. Since disney was booked, I opted for this "resort" because of its closeness to Disney. We payed $120.00 per night (and that was with a priority club discount) to stay in a very old hotel. The outside of the hotel is very dirty and had an overall unsafe feeling at night (very dim walkways/parking lots). There were two refrigerators in our room, neither of them worked. The staff was pretty much un-friendly and when told about the refrigerator problem gave us a coupon to the pizza place in the resort. Across the street is a Ramada Hotel that is much nicer (still somewhat old building and outdoor entrances), just as close, and was available for 1/2 the price. This holiday inn is definately not a resort by anyones definition and is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NickyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 year old son and i have just returned from the Nikki Bird after spending Christmas and New Year there. After reading some of the reviews i was a little concerned ......... however, I did not need to be concerned. Our room was very clean and spacious, towels changed daily, bedding changed every 3 days and the room was more than adequate for what we required. However, i do agree with some of the reviews that the hotel is in need of exterior decoration. The staff were very friendly and dealt with everything promptly. On our second morning the coffee machine was not working, my husband phoned reception and within 5 minutes a member of staff was at our room with a replacement ...... you can't ask for a more prompt service! We had breakfast at Angels every morning as the food and the service was very good and we never felt rushed, and there was no charge for our son due to staying at the hotel. It is ideally situated for the Disney parks and there is a selection of restaurants and shops to walk to if you do not want to drive in the evening. We did not use the trnsportation to the Disney parks as we had a car. We would definately return to the Nikki Bird again.

Reviews.Title: “El Cheapo- But Where is the Bird?”
Reviews.Author: VacationGoddess1
Reviews.Content: Okay, this motel has a lame name, but for a one night stay it was okay. It was cheap too. I was disappointed because I never once saw the "Nikki Bird" character. It's just a regular motel, so don't get your hopes up. It's not a resort by any means, it's just a place to sleep mainly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel Shuttle to Park a Joke”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First the positives as a trip advisor ratings checker myself I know that people want the full picture the positives far outweighed the negatives. The hotel itself was clean and the rooms acceptable, brightly colored and filled with all the amenities we could need. The staff was VERY friendly especially in the diner and at the front desk. The negatives, The entire property is in need of a sprucing up especially paint but as we were there for Disney anyway who cared. There were only two serious downfalls I could find, The pools were all supposed to be heated. At the time of our visit only one was heated and this I did not find out until our last day :( The hottubs were in need of some help as well one was dirty with a film all around the edges, one was closed and the last one was not really hot. The other problem was the "free shuttle" First the shuttle only leaves the hotel three times daily this was a major scheduling problem, second the bus was reminicent of that bus from the muppets I was not sure it was even going to make it to the resort, and last but not least there was a very large sign on the bus making it VERY clear that a tip was expected. We took one trip on the bus and decided that was more than enough. We also learned not to use the taxi service provided by the hotel they were $4 more expensive per trip that Checker cab (Disney's Approved Co) We found the least expensive way to get to the parks were to take a Checker cab to MGM and hitch a ride on Disney buses to any other park the cab to MGM was $8-10. The cab to the Kingdom was $16. Overall my experiance was positive I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big, budget but can't be beaten!”
Reviews.Author: SailorJag
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 consecutive nights at the Holiday Inn Nikki Bird in Kissimmee twice in the last 3 weeks. This is definitely not the Ritz but it's clean, quiet and centrally located to everything from theme parks, the airport, hospitals and places to eat. Both stays were consistent. Rooms were newly reburbished with small fridge and microwave. No stained carpets, cigarette burns in bathroom or anything you normally get with a budget property. I did not frequent their restaurants or pools but I inspected the pools and they were clean, well maintained and in good shape (perfect for families with children) I found deals on site59.com so the price is right when bundled with airfare or car. Talk about a value! I will be back soon. (do not let the older outer appearance fool you, rooms are remodeled and decent)Checkin fast & friendly, parking ample and easy. Enter rooms from out side (note: there are no elevators at this 2 story property so ask for first floor if you have disabled persons)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: agioe
Reviews.Content: We were two adults destined for Walt Disney World. My friend had never been to Disney before, so we looked for a reasonable hotel, close to Disney. We didn't need a "resort" because we knew we'd be at one of the parks from opening to closing. We rented a car and the hotel was easy to find from the airport. The desk personnel were very friendly. The room was clean. We had a microwave, a refrigerator and a safe. The front desk told us where the closest, cheapest grocery was - just a mile away. We bought drinks, snacks, breakfast stuff, etc. We got up early, made our own breakfast and were out the door for Disney between 7:30-8am. It was an easy right turn out of the hotel and the exit for Disney was 1 mile away. We would get to the parking lots as they were opening and were right in the first few rows of parking making it easy to find the car! We found it best to always park at Epcot, even if you were going somewhere else first. Parking at Magic Kingdom is kind of "off site" so to speak. Then you can use the monorail and buses between the other parks. You need to be at Epcot in time for the opening..what a great experience. All the workers come up to greet you and all the characters too! Then they escort you back to the rides. It was a blast! Take one of the behind the scenes tours. We did the Backstage Disney (adults only) and it was awesome...worth every dime. Anyway, back to the hotel...we'd get back in the evening and pick a in room movie, pop some popcorn and fall asleep, then start over again the next day. We sat in the hot tub one night to rest our weary bones..otherwise we could have cared less about the hotel amenities, would have been a waste for us. For only $45 a night, we wanted to spend our money and time elsewhere! Perfect for our situation!

Reviews.Title: “Back again after a month!”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: After reviewing it once I find myself accidentally back here a month later! I had to change vacation plans and arrive a day early. I booked a room here on Priceline for 49 dollars about 3 days before the hurricane Wilma began approaching. When we arrived on a Friday, the hotel was very crowded! Still, we were checked in by a very friendly young lady and were in our room 10 min later. Again, the decor was dated but the room and bathroom were spotless. A second opinion from my husband was that the room was better than he expected. We walked to dinner a few blocks away, also discovered that there is a handy bus system available. We enjoyed an empty pool and a hot tub which was just outside our door. The breakfast eggs/grits were a bit bland; I was prepared and brought my own salsa! Though there were many families and it was busy, service was excellent. I'm glad to say that my two stays at the Nikki Bird were pleasant, that I slept well, the air conditioning worked and the staff was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Well not the worst. Clean and cheap.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was welcoming. Room was clean. Price incredibly cheap around 54 dollars per night booked through site 59. Helpful hint is to have a priority club card. We got free local calls and late checkout. However, room smelled like mold, shower runs hot and cold. Toilet didn't overflow, but didn't flush either. Buffet breakfast at Angels dreadful --lots of greasy bacon and they charge extra for coffee and other drinks two bucks extra. Go to waffle house instead. To ward off insistent maids put the do not disturb sign on door. Also, better not let the kiddies play video games they run right into the next hour without notice. All in all, not unpleasant, but really I think there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great at all”
Reviews.Author: JonNorwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days at the end of our two week florida holiday and it was a shame to end the holiday on a low note. We booked a king size non-smoking room but upon check-in were told there were none, and we could have a queen size or a smoking room (but they'd give us an air freshener!). We opted for queen size but the room was filthy, dingy and the bathroom was a disgrace. We changed rooms to a twin double room, it was lighter but the bathroom wasn't up to much, the room was satisfactorily clean but not great. Literature promised HBO but you didn't get it. I agree with the comments on security: not much around. Pools were OK but could have been cleaner. Location was v. close to Disney but we preferred I-Drive as there was more within walking distance. No decent bar at this hotel, just an overly bright bit of the quite awful "angels" restaurant. Didn't have dinner but breakfast wasn't great value for the money, was cold, with poor quality ingredients. Staff on reception weren't particularly welcoming. I guess this hotel would be okay for kids but not for adult couples. It wasn't awful, but we stayed in much better much cleaner hotels for the same money. It's just a bit run down and needs some investment and better standards of cleanliness. Hope this is of some help.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying the rooms were pretty clean. However, there are many reasons why I would not stay again. We had a room that had a seperate section for our son. It was an enclosed, three (very small-short) bunk beds area. The beds did not even have a bottom sheet on the bed. I didn't really notice until I woke my son up in the morning. He didn't say anything that night because he is young and was excited about the Game Cube in his area. I thought maybe housekeeping overlooked it, but that day when housekeeping came in they just made the bed back up like it was. Also, every morning housekeeping would bang on our door at 8:30 wanting to come in and clean the room. I tried saying loudly "we're sleeping" but, she just kept pounding until I got up and answered the door; thank god I wasn't showering! The toilet had a hard time flushing because of the water pressure, but once it flushed it would run until you jiggled the handle. The shower turns hot and cold when the surrounding rooms are using water also. The Game Cube is set to charge $7.50 an hour so make sure your kids know how long they've been playing. Also, we made a toll free number call and the hotel charged us an $8.00 phone fee and to call locally to Arabian Knights (5 minute drive) cost us $1.50 each time. This hotel ran about $115.00 each night. We went on a Disney Cruise and then stayed here for 2 nights.
