On the way to the cruise we stayed at the Howard Johnson Enchanted (about ten minutes down the street from this hotel). We were just sleeping the night so we got a cheap hotel, $54.00 per night, but we got what we expected. The Hojo was AS NICE AS the Holiday Inn NikKi Bird and it cost half as much!! Just FYI...Arabian Knight's had horrible food. It was so bad that the guy next to me sent his back and asked for a plate full of only mashed potatoes. My prime rib tasted like dog food. It is "all you can drink" wine or beer, but it's a very cheap wine and busch beer. It cost about $47.00 per person and that does not include tip. The show was alright. Mostly horses running around in circles, but my 7 yr old seem to enjoy it. However, after the show he said "I can't believe we paid that much to see that." I know I sound like everything was bad, but this is actually the first review I've ever written. I told my husband that if I had read a review about this place and the show...that I wouldn't have wasted my money. We spent over $350.00 for 2 nights in the hotel and the show and I feel it was a waste. Universal Studios, on the other hand, ROCKED!!

Reviews.Title: “it`s a Motel”
Reviews.Author: vmimartins
Reviews.Content: This is a huge motel with a hotel name. Old building and decor. From outside the rooms area seems like an Indian Guest House - no renovation ever and everything looks old. The rooms are okay, clean but our A/c was noisy and droped water to the floor on the outside. This is not a good hotel, is outdated the rooms are average and if you travel under a budget why not stay here ? I`ll never stay again and I do not recomend it. About the location, there are plenty of hotels in the area so .... choose another...

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited this Hotel July 2005. Among the many Hotels that are clustered all along hwy 192, This Hotel is located in the best spot, for being outside the parks. My family and I enjoyed staying here very much and will not hesitate staying here when we return to the area. Our room was great. Our children were very satisfied with our room and like the privacy they had in the kids suite. My wife and I really were suprised that the suite we had, had actually 4 beds. 1-queen size bed, 1 bunk bed w/ 2-beds and then a another bed in the kids section. this was perfect for our family of 5. The quality of the room was great. They could use more trash cans in a room suited for 5 people, but the overall room outweighed that. We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed the easy access to Disney and the surrounding areas. The staff was great. They were very infomative. As fas as the smell that everyone seems to write about in their reviews, the only time I smelled lobster was well,...when they were cooking lobster. The buffet and angels diner were great places to eat as well, especially after a long day at the parks, they were right on the property. This Hotel was a great place to stay. I reccomend this place highly. Hope you will enjoy your stay. We did.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Sutton Coldfield West Midlands United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “great holiday at Disney”
Reviews.Author: croydesuncot
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Nikki Bird Holiday inn, a 3 star hotel. The rooms have been refurbished with new painted walls, new carpet and new bed linen, making the room excellent. The familly room we had over looked the swimming pool, and gardens, better than the rooms arround the edge which over looked the car park. The room had air conditioning, perfect for the those hot days and nights. The hotel rooms are cleaned daily, with clean towels and made beds to excellent standard. The two weeks we stopped there have been relaxing and peacefull, specially after having a busy day visiting Disney, Epcot and water parks which are only 10 to 15 Minutes down the road. We recommend this hotel for its frendly and helpfull staff and excellent postion for Disney, a hire car is recommended. Visited between 9 July to 23 July 2005

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent by budget standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel three years runung. We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful. We have emialed them with various requests which have all been met promptly. We are returning August 2005 and we cannot wiat. There has never been any problems with our room and if there was we know confidently that it would be dealt with immediately. Our immediate contact via email has been the best person ever, and we wouldn't ever have a bad word sia against them. The pools have been excellent with a constant supply of towels. The staff in the restaurants have always been able to accomodate our finicky daughter, which is no mean feat I can tell you. Also the people delivering room service have always been polite and helpful no matter what time you order. We haven't used the shuttle service, but if we do when we go in August 2005 I'm sure this will also be excellent. All in all a total thumbs up for the Nikki Bird. any queries please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “very convineint, easy to get to all of the parks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, I dont think you could beat it. The rooms were sufficient for our stay. Our rooms were kept clean, the beds were made daily and we always had a fresh supply of towels and coffee was always replenished. There was a video game system in the room, but there was a charge for it. We did not have time to use it anyway with all that we had to do. We utilized the ironing board, hair dryer, refrigerator and microwave which was very convenient. It is 5 minutes from Disney, and minutes to most other parks and attractions, we could have been there for weeks with all there is to do around there. We had a wonderful time on our vacation and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina1972
Reviews.Content: I just returned from vacation and stayed at the Holiday Inn Nikki Bird. I found the hotel staff to be warm and friendly. The free shuttle thnat is provided was very convenient although it did not run as frequent as expected. The rooms are clean and having the fridge and microwave was a plus as I frequented the Seven 11 store that is directly across the street from the hotel. We were provided with fresh towels and coffee daily. I would actually offer one suggestion and that would be to get a room in the back because of the busy I drive. Sometimes I was awakened by trucks beeping horns in the middle of the night. Also, the bus driver, Joe ( I think his name is) is very pleasant and made for an enjoyable trip to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “great value family place”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggirl
Reviews.Content: what a great family place to stay. We arrived quite late on the friday night , the receptionist was very friendly and a great help. After reading some of the reviews i was not sure what to expect when we reached our room, but it was very clean and very deserving of the 3 star rating this country has given it. The pools were great, very clean both inside and outside the pools, they were open til quite late at night, so after a long day it was nice to have a swim. The angel diner was great for buffet breakfast food was good and kids eat free! Overall i think this is a great family place to stop and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed here for a week!”
Reviews.Author: Nails54
Reviews.Content: We had one night here. Walking distance to the pool area. Staff were very helpful getting our room ready early because we had arrived 4 hours ahead a of time. Angles Dinner was fun stepping back into the fifties food was good too. As for the buffet breakfast it was okay. Now having dinner at the buffet was great you could find everything you wanted and more. Now checking out of the hotel. Our flight didn't leave until 7 that night so they extended our stay until 3pm no extra charge. Now that's a holiday and hat's off to the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a great time !! the service was great and so was the food ! we stayed in a standard room and everything was clean we had a fridge and a coffee maker.The food was proper american food and tasty!! There were 3 pools and they were clean.check-in was easy.the only thing i wouldnt reccomend is the shuttle buses you can never see the shows at disney!!!we would deafinitely reccomend this hotel to anyone with a family!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late April. Of course, going to Disney and Universal took up most of our time and we only slept here except for a brief hour at the pool and lunch in the diner on day 1. The pool was clean and lunch was very good. We did eat at the dinner buffet one night. The food was very good but there was one big dissapointment...the crab legs were not that good. My son and I love crab legs and these were small and the taste was not quite right. My wife said the lobster was chewy and had little taste. The prime rib and other items were fantastic, though, so I did not go away hungry. The line to the buffet was long on this early Friday evening. Service to both restaurants was very good as well. As for our rooms, they were clean and well taken care of by our housekeeping attendant each day. This would have been a great place to just relax and enjoy the wonderful resort facilities but of course, we spent far more on attraction tickets to the parks and that was our main reason for visiting this time. The grounds were beautiful and well taken care of. I would definitely return to this hotel. It is not "luxury" with marble floors and plush carpeting but I wouldn't want that anyway. I felt very comfortable just like being at home. We all slept well, enjoyed hot showers, brewed a cup of coffee each morning, and took a minute to watch the Weather Channel to check on the snow falling at home in Pittsburgh! Great time!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: RiuFamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Holiday Nikki Bird in April 2004. We were impressed when we drove in. The rooms were average. The rooms were clean especialy the bathroom. We had locked ourselves out of our room. Someone was there in less than 5 minutes. Staff was very polite and kind. The pools were awesome and the children's playground was nice too. The Angel's Diner was great, only complaint was long line ups to get to food. Only disappontment was we were on the 2nd floor and they have no elevators. 5 minutes by car to most attractions. No pushy sales people for time shares. Other than that I give it 3 stars rather than the 2 stars it was rated.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: sarahlou145
Reviews.Content: After reading some recent reviews i felt i should write a review on Nikki Bird. I have stayed there twice now (September 2000 and September 2003), both stays were fantastic. The rooms were great. They were clean, the maid visited every day, the bathroom was immaculate. Working fridge, microwave and safe. On our second stay we came home one evening to find our air conditioning unit had stopped working, we found the reception and within 10 mins the maintenance guy was there and within 30 minutes we had a brand new air conditioning unit fitted. The pools were lovely, always clean, i never saw any rubbish lying around. And the jacuzzi was lovely after a day at the parks. Food in the restaurant and diner was superb at all times of the day, although we did eat a lot in the ponderosa nearby also as we loved the steak there. The shuttle bus was fine, although it could get a bit crowded at times, but not too much of an issue. We have just booked to go back there this September and cant wait. Feel free to email me if you want any more info.

Reviews.Title: “lousy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Holiday Inn resorts wtih no problem but this one was an exception. The hotel is very dingy and outdated. The pools are large but boring and not well maintained, trash from one day would still be there the next and there were hardly ever towels available. The fitness center was very small and also dirty, with trash left there for the whole week we were there. The food in the restaurants was good, but if you do the seafood buffet be prepared to wait in long lines. The hotel is conveniently located to the parks but the shuttles are only offered at one time each day and those times are not very convenient. The movie channel on the t.v. was unavailable the whole week we were there. Although it was relatively inexpensive we will not be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here at Nikki Bird. The hotel is okay. The rooms were a bit dirty, stains on the blankets, rusty sinks and bath tubs with mold. We had a kids suite. Not real big, but better than 2 double beds. Our 3 kids were a tight fit in the pint size bunk bed and twin bed in the "kids" room. I think the beds are about five feet long if that. Smaller than other kids suites in the area. The front desk staff is not very friendly. We could never get a good room location. The parking was the worst. We had to park very far away from our room. This was the case every night if we got back later than 10pm. After a long day and night at the parks it was frustrating to have to walk so far and then come in to your room where the maid turned off the air conditioning. This happened every day. She never left new soap, toilet paper or any other amenity. I left a pretty good tip the first day hoping for some improvement, but none. They have a pretty good arcade for the kids. The pools look really nice and the grounds are well maintained. They are known to have a good restaurant, angels, but we could not get in without a very long wait. We never did eat there. In fact, we were not there much at all. It just was not the kind of place we wanted to hang around. We may go back but not until I find there have been some improvements. We stayed our last 4 nights at Seralago Hotel. They had a much nicer kids suite, but they are pretty average as well.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: Bonarie
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from staying at the Holiday Inn Nikki Bird and we absolutely loved it! We were there for 10 days-checked out on December 13th, 2004 and it was fantastic! We booked it over the internet and had no idea what to expect, some of the reviews we read were quite unflattering. We are a middle income family of 6 who would much rather spend the money on the daylight hours of our holiday as we generally just sleep in a hotel as days are busy--this motel surprised us, as it offers great prices and it truly exceeded all expectations! Yes, the motel is older looking on the outside as it is an older two story but the inside is bright, updated and cheery! While we were there they were putting in new carpets-we were the first to stay in the room we had--it was newly and nicely decorated, beds were comfortable, we had 2 double beds plus a double sofa bed plus a fridge and microwave and an in-room safe. Yes, some of the furniture edges of desk or chair had some paint scuffs but nothing that would make you think it was not worthy of trying it--unless you are used to expensive 5 star hotels that is! The pool areas were gorgeous, play area great, the breakfast buffet was a real deal and it was very tasty! Kids under 12 eat free and all the staff is very friendly and obliging! We demand clean and safe hotels and this one met all of our expectations--the kids loved the play ground and spent every night after a long day sight seeing in the heated pools. You will not find a closer hotel to the parks without staying onsite. There is a set of lights as soon as you go to leave the hotel parking lot, turn right drive one mile and you are on Disney property! At the longest amount of time it took us no more than 10-15 minutes to be at the park and enjoying our day instead of being stuck in traffic! We never judge a hotel but its outside as some of the ones which are all glitz and glam on the outside are horrid. Just thought I would give you an update from someone who just returned from a trip there. We are going to recommend this "hidden jewel" to anyone travelling to this area! __________________

Reviews.Title: “good standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after trawling through many reviews of various hotels in the area, I decieded on the Nikki bird, got an excellent rate of 49.99 we stayed for 9 nights, swam each day in the 3 excellent pool areas, had a good room in a good location. ive been to orlando a few times before and this did not disapoint.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Boxingfan82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nikki Bird from 7/23 to 7/28. Having read the numerous negative reviews on this website I arrived expecting the worst and this hotel more than met those expectations. Upon our arrival we were told our room had been given away on accident and that we would need to stay in a Kiddie Suite. I didnt think this would be to bad. As we walked to the room we were shocked at the condition of the hotel. It looked like it hadnt been remodeled since the 70's with rust and mildew on the walls and doors. As we approached our room we noticed an odor that smelled similar to raw sewage. As we entered our room the odor only became stronger. Upon inspection of the room we observed very outdated decorations and faded comforters and lamp shades. The bed we were left to sleep in could not have been much bigger than a twin and we had requested a king. The kiddie suite is laughable as it is notihng more than a standard hotel room divided in half with a ridiculous looking divider. Inside are two bunk beds that are best suited for midgets. The TV did not work and the bathroom was horrendous. The shower was a stall and when you used it the entire bathroom filled with water. After 1 night I requested to move rooms. We were then moved to another room hoping that it would be a vast improvement. It wasnt. This rooms carpet was constantly damp and the room smelled musty. The furniture and beds looked outdated and blood was on the bathroom door. To top it off the safe didnt work. We called maintenance and they were unable to fix it. The premises itself is in terrible condition and the restaraunt horrible. The shuttle offered to WDW is terribly unreliable and inconvient. All pick ups from the parks are on off times and if you want to stay for fireworks or end of the evening shows you most likely will miss the bus. This occurred on our last night at the hotel. I would reccomend serious renovations for the hotel. It is no better than a super 8 and Holiday Inn should seriously consider dumping this hotel from its brand. MY ADVICE: STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Nikki Bird Holiday Inn is called a "resort". I would like to know where? The room stinks and is so much noise outside the rooms because the doors are right in from of the parking lot. When sleeping some guys passed outside the room talking very loud and crashing bottles in the parking lot. Overall, my experience there was not nice at all. I do not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: faliraki88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Nikki Bird in October 2003 with my family including a 4 year old and a 5 year old. This was our first time in America and didnt know quite what to expect. After a 10 hour flight with MyTravel (the longest flight weve ever been on) we arrived at Orlando-Sanford Airport at 5.30pm and we were in a tropical storm (the rain and the thunder is much more powerful here than at home) Also because the luggage belt area was so busy and crowded we got delayed getting our luggage and so missed our coach transfer to the Nikki Bird which panicked us a bit, anyway the friendly staff and the Airtours reps arranged for us and other holiday makers who had missed their coach to travel on another coach to get to our hotel. We arrived at Nikki Bird and first impressions were good-it looked clean and welcoming. The check-in procedure took about 10 minutes and just after we had checked in (being very tired-we had been awake for nearly a day) we were shocked to hear loud sirens with flashing lights with people running around. (this turned out to be a fire alarm test) We just stood at reception/the lobby with our 4 suitcases wondering what the hell we had come to, but...We got to our room and found everything to be clean and of an average standard. The only problem with the room was that we couldnt really use the draws to put our clothes in because they were damp and smelly and so had to leave our clothes in the suitcases for the 2 week stay. The pool shaped as Mickey Mouse was excellent and it was heated which was very nice and you could use the pools in the evening too, the other 2 pools looked nice but we never used them as our room was nearer to the Mickey pool. The Diner and breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced. There was also a small gift shop on site. We used the Pizza Hut quite often and the food was always very tasty. The kids enjoyed the outdoor playground. We didnt find the Nikki Bird rooms to be old or dated we just found them different as we were used to apartments in Spain, Turkey and Cyprus, we actualy found the rooms nice it wasnt dirty at all, anyway we werent going to be spending a lot of time in the room-it was just somewhere to sleep and get changed,(After all you dont go to Orlando to sit in your room all day do you?) The hotel was in an excellent location just 5mins away from Disney (probably about 10mins away if you use the shuttle bus) The shuttle bus was always on time but got over crowded and therfore was slower. Seaworld and Universal are about 15-25mins away. The hotel was within easy walking distance to shops, restaurants, fast food outlets, bars and nightlife. I would give the location a 10 out of 10, brilliant!. The Holiday Inn Nikki Bird has lovely surroundings. The staff were great and most were VERY friendly. You get value for money. The broucher says its a 3* and I would agree. Its not 5* luxury but it is a wonderful place to stay and when we eventuly go back to sunny Florida we will certainly go back to the Nikki Bird. Its a great place for a family to stay. The Airtours holiday reps were helpful and were there if we needed them. Next time we wont be so nervous going to America!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awful, rust on room walls, blood on bathroom walls, chipped paint on floor. Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Nikki Bird-It 'bugged' me a bit”
Reviews.Author: beachbumm
Reviews.Content: The pools were great. Our room had an ant problem...we opened the microcart drawer and it was infested bad. We had donuts that were still in the cardboard from the store and the ants somehow found their way into them. We had to throw everything away...even though nothing was left open the ants found their way in anyway. It was really hard to sleep knowing that insects were crawling everywhere. Everything considered it was a good price and good location...just bring the bug spray.

Reviews.Title: “Aftermath of Charley”
Reviews.Author: Kateezdad
Reviews.Content: Arrived @ Nikki Bird Saturday 14th the day after Charley had swept through Kissimmee. The computers had been down until 3pm that day so as you can imagine the atmosphere at the check in desk was rather tense. No need to have worried, after a few false starts Brian del Toro and his team pulled off a marvelous job and got our room etc sorted, along with complimentary vouchers for Angels Diner....excellent food & service. All in all a wonderful 14 night stay and I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Paul, UK

Reviews.Title: “excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Travelling solo with two children under the age of 10 was quite intimidating but I neednt have worried. The rooms we booked werent available when we arrived so we were immediatly upgraded to a kids suite which pleased the children. They were impresed by the pools and being able to play in them when it was dark.Also the bubbly hot one were mummy can put her feet (description of a hot tub by a 6 year old).The rooms were clean service second to none. The diner was superb and the food excellent also the price was excellent. If you go watch out for pops my 6 yearold thinks he is in love with her. There is also a regular courtesy bus service to WDW four times in a am and the same at night. so no need to hire a car. All in all a thourghly enjoyable stay in fact so much so we are now busy saving up to go again soon

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week long stay at the Nikki Bird. Really sweated it out after reading such negative reviews. We rented 8 rooms for our group and not one complaint. The hotel is nice and clean and the rooms were more than adequate. The staff was very friendly from top to bottom. The kids loved all of the pools and the arcade. Laundry facilities were wonderful. Great location for Disney. About 20 minutes to Universal. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. If you are looking for extravagant then stay somewhere else. If you are looking for pleasant, clean and comfortable..stay at the Nikki Bird.
